alert.note: Alert for Seward (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 9:43PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Seward County through 1015 PM CDT... At 943 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles west of Beaver Crossing, or 11 miles east of York, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Utica and Beaver Crossing around 950 PM CDT. Goehner around 955 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Staplehurst and Seward. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 366 and 382. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
